title: Houston veggie restaurants
name: Houston veggie restaurants
description:
A Map by Happykatie

Houston's got some amazing restaurants, but we are admittedly a pretty big steak/bbq city.  Where do you go in Houston to get your tofu, tempeh and veggies on??

properties.name: Baba Yega
properties.description: Posted by Transfairusa fair trade

properties.name: Balaji Bhavan
properties.description: Posted by Rakeshagrawal 5655 Hilcroft, 77036I swear by this place as a vegatarian and a fan of Indian food. My favorites are their chole bhature (garbanzo beans plus a fried bread) and their aloo parantha (potato bread). My wife likes their south indian fare -- dosa and idli.

properties.name: Bombay Sweets Vegetarian Restaurant
properties.description: Posted by Happykatie 5827 Hillcroft St. Houston TXCrazy-good Indian vegetarian buffet. Comfort food at its finest - with beautiful colorful Indian dessert cases to gaze at while eating. Pretty hole-in-the-wall-like, but that\'s part of what makes it good. Very family friendly. If vegan, do watch out for cheese/dairy in some dishes.

properties.name: Cafe Caspian
properties.description: Posted by Favouritethings 12126 Westheimer, Houston, TXPersian food. TONS of yummy non-boring vegetarian options - always share. HUGE portions. Super friendly staff very helpful if you don\'t know what to order.

properties.name: Cricket's Creamery & Cafe
properties.description: Posted by Happykatie  This is a whimsical little cafe hidden on 19th St. in the Heights. The gelato is fabulous, but I\'m in love with the sandwiches (open faced tomato caprese... yummmm), great veggie soups and salads. Cricket\'s always has some fresh new kind of fresh bread ready to be drooled over and desserts to split with your lunch pal. Super great place to rest during a shopping trip on 19th or just to grab a quaint satisfying lunch on your own.

properties.name: Dragon Bowl
properties.description: Posted by Favouritethings 1221 11th Houston, TX 77007Build your own bowl ... and tofu as your protein. TONS of really fresh options.

properties.name: Field of Greens
properties.description: Posted by F18passfield2320 W Alabama St, Houston, TX

properties.name: Jenni's Noodle House
properties.description: Posted by Happykatie 2130 Jefferson Houston txRidiculously good noodles and soups for meat-lovers and veggies alike. HUGE vegan favorite: the Art Car Curry. For starters, we really love the crispy tofu sticks and dream rolls. I think they put crack in their house soy sauce -- I have dreams about it on particularly hungry evenings.

properties.name: Late Nite Pie
properties.description: Posted by Happykatie502 Elgin St. houston txReally great veggie pizzas and subs. Even better than those is the garlic butter dipping sauce. Cheap pitchers of beer and a jukebox, very cool dinner out.

properties.name: Niko Niko's
properties.description: Posted by Happykatie 2520 Montrose Blvd houston txHeavenly Greek food. Lemon potato nirvana. The felafel is *good*, not the best ever but always satisfying. The vegetarian grape leaves (Yolandji dolmas) are oh-so-wonderful. This is one of the most addictive restaurants in Houston.

properties.name: Onion Creek Coffee House
properties.description: Posted by Happykatie     3106 White Oak Blvd Houston TXAwesome neighborhood hang-out spot with live music (DJ Sun!!) and a great patio area. Good beer, amazing veggie pizza, fresh salads, tasty veggie burger and perfect waffles.... we come here almost weekly. Good stuff. Don\'t forget the Farmer\'s Market here on Sat. 8-12.

properties.name: Pepper Tree
properties.description: Posted by Escapevelocity3821 Richmond, 77027Vegetarian/Vegan-friendly Chinese restaurant. The sweet & sour "chicken" (made from wheat gluten) is really good. It\'s in the strip at the corner of Richmond and Weslayan, next to the Chipotle.

properties.name: Phoenicia Deli
properties.description: Posted by Favouritethings 12116 Westheimer, Houston, TXMy fav greek salad anywhere in Houston. Good falafels & other veggie options too.

properties.name: Sandy's Produce Market & Vitamins
properties.description: Posted by Happykatie 12171 Katy Frwy Houston TXAwesome fresh salad bar and great hot food, soups, fresh breads and desserts. Be sure to sample some of their hot tea - served just for you with ginger cookies. One of my favorite places to eat in Houston. They do serve some meat products, but as a vegan or vegetarian you get some really super tasty options as well.

properties.name: Star Pizza
properties.description: Posted by Happykatie 77 Harvard St houston txVery fresh and tasty pizza with some great vegetarian appetizers. Extra bonus - vegans can order pizzas sans cheese and still have a very tasty meal. Foccacia crust is a huge hit at our place.

properties.name: Te House of Tea
properties.description: Posted by Happykatie  Te House of Tea has an amazing selection of tea (well, duh) as well as some great veggie-friendly baked goods, salads and soups. Free Wifi, chill atmosphere, good lighting and decent music make this a really great place to meet up with friends and more-than-friends.

properties.name: Tien Ren Vegetarian Restaurant
properties.description: Posted by Happycow 7549 Westheimer Rd, Houston, TX100% VegetarianRestaurantReviews

properties.name: Whole Foods Market
properties.description: Posted by HappycowVegetarian FriendlyHealth Food StoreReviews

properties.name: Ziggy's Healthy Grill
properties.description: Posted by Escapevelocity2202 W Alabama, 77098A mostly vegetarian place that\'s carnivore-friendly.
